name: Marie Curie
description: Marie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the only person to ever win one in two different fields- both physics and chemistry! She coined the term radioactivity and discovered the elements polonium and radium. During World War One she developed mobile x-ray machines for use in field hospitals. Sadly all the exposure to radiation took it's toll and she died of aplastic anemia in 1934 aged 66.
